  "description": "PGE Travels and Education Consulting is a dynamic and customer-focused travel and education agency committed to making global travel and study opportunities accessible and seamless. We specialize in admission processing, visa application, flight booking, travel insurance, and comprehensive educational consultancy services.

Our goal is to provide tailored solutions that meet the unique travel and academic aspirations of our clients. Whether you are planning to study abroad, explore new destinations, or secure the right travel documentation, PGE Travels and Education Consulting offers expert guidance every step of the way.

We pride ourselves on our professionalism, integrity, and dedication to client satisfaction, making us a trusted partner for individuals and families pursuing international travel and educational goals. Join us and be part of a team that is passionate about creating life-changing opportunities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance &amp; Account Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Mainland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking an experienced and professional Finance &amp; Account Officer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, managing budgets, preparing reports, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations.
	This role requires a proactive individual who is proficient in accounting software, highly analytical, and able to support the organisation in making sound financial decisions.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day financial operations including accounts payable/receivable, invoicing, and reconciliations.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, balance sheet, income satement and cash flow.
	Maintain accurate records of financial transactions in line with legal and regulatory requirements.
	Assist with budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning.
	Monitor cash flow, expenditures, and internal controls.
	Ensure timely tax computation, remittance, and compliance (PAYE, VAT, WHT, etc.).
	Work closely with external auditors and tax authorities when required.
	Analyse financial data to identify trends and make recommendations.
	Support management with financial insights for strategic decision-making.
	Maintain a good and professional relationship with the internal and external stake holder including client and employees
	Perform other accounting task as required by the organisation


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a finance/accounting role.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent) is an added advantage.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, Zoho Books, or similar).
	Strong understanding of Nigerian financial regulations and tax compliance.
	Excellent analytical and numerical skills.
	Attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to work independently and within a team.


Salary &amp; Benefits


	Salary: Competitive (Based on experience and qualifications)
	Access to career development and professional growth opportunities
	Supportive work environment with ongoing training
	Opportunity to work within a fast-growing and globally focused travel brand


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;careers@pgeeducation.com&nbsp;using &quot;Finance &amp; Account Officer Application&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

Finance & Account Officer Job at PGE Travels and Education Consulting




        
    

        
        PGE Travels and Education Consulting is a dynamic and customer-focused travel and education agency committed to making global travel and study opportunities accessible and seamless. We specialize in admission processing, visa application, flight booking, travel insurance, and comprehensive educational consultancy services.

Our goal is to provide tailored solutions that meet the unique travel and academic aspirations of our clients. Whether you are planning to study abroad, explore new destinations, or secure the right travel documentation, PGE Travels and Education Consulting offers expert guidance every step of the way.
     

            
    



We pride ourselves on our professionalism, integrity, and dedication to client satisfaction, making us a trusted partner for individuals and families pursuing international travel and educational goals. Join us and be part of a team that is passionate about creating life-changing opportunities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance & Account Officer

Job Location: Mainland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking an experienced and professional Finance & Account Officer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, managing budgets, preparing reports, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations.
	This role requires a proactive individual who is proficient in accounting software, highly analytical, and able to support the organisation in making sound financial decisions.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day financial operations including accounts payable/receivable, invoicing, and reconciliations.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, balance sheet, income satement and cash flow.
	Maintain accurate records of financial transactions in line with legal and regulatory requirements.
	Assist with budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning.
	Monitor cash flow, expenditures, and internal controls.
	Ensure timely tax computation, remittance, and compliance (PAYE, VAT, WHT, etc.).
	Work closely with external auditors and tax authorities when required.
	Analyse financial data to identify trends and make recommendations.
	Support management with financial insights for strategic decision-making.
	Maintain a good and professional relationship with the internal and external stake holder including client and employees
	Perform other accounting task as required by the organisation


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a finance/accounting role.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent) is an added advantage.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, Zoho Books, or similar).
	Strong understanding of Nigerian financial regulations and tax compliance.
	Excellent analytical and numerical skills.
	Attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to work independently and within a team.


Salary & Benefits


	Salary: Competitive (Based on experience and qualifications)
	Access to career development and professional growth opportunities
	Supportive work environment with ongoing training
	Opportunity to work within a fast-growing and globally focused travel brand


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to: careers@pgeeducation.com using "Finance & Account Officer Application" as the subject of the mail.

General Assistant Job at May Publishing Limited




        
    

        
        
     

            
    

May Publishing Limited is a research, knowledge management and publishing firm, which has continued to pursue remarkable heights in the production, management and preservation of knowledge, in scholarly and strategic research and publishing, and in the development of high standards in literacy and learning through general interest works. With its excellent research-oriented publications and professionally articulated compendiums of biographies, autobiographies, corporate histories, and scholarly literatures, it has been distinguished for and committed to the digital documentation of knowledge and information that are essential to the high value-orientation and development of society. Through its cutting-edge research, professional editorial processes, and unique methods of harnessing and producing audience-compelling narratives, the firm has been assigned world-class projects from top-class individuals, corporate entities, and other states institutions, the depth of which has been attested by readers as appealing, engaging and significant to human, social and corporate development.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Assistant

Job Location: Magodo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a reliable, hardworking, and versatile General Assistant to join our team. As a General Assistant, you will be responsible for providing administrative, domestic, and general support to ensure the smooth operation of our office and household.


Key Responsibilities


	Clean and maintain the office and household.
	Run errands, such as grocery shopping and picking up supplies.
	Assist with household chores, such as cooking, washing dishes, and ironing.
	Provide administrative support such as filing documents.
	Assist with other tasks as assigned.


Requirements


	High school diploma or equivalent required with a minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role
	Excellent communication and organizational skills
	Excellent computer skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Reliable, hardworking, and versatile


Working Conditions:


	Monday to Friday
	Occasional evening or weekend work may be required


Salary
N50,000 - N65,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidate should send their CV and Application Letter to: maypublishingltd@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Project Manager Job at Aril Technologies Limited




        
    

        
        Aril Technologies Limited is a leading Engineering Technology and Procurement company dedicated to providing innovative solutions in various industries. With a focus on excellence and efficiency, we deliver cutting-edge engineering services and procurements to meet the evolving needs of our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Project Manager will be responsible for overseeing the planning, execution, and successful completion of engineering and procurement projects.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong background in project management methodologies, excellent organizational skills, and the ability to lead cross-functional teams to meet project goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Project Planning and Scheduling: Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and schedules to ensure the successful execution of projects. Coordinate with engineering, procurement, and other internal teams to ensure alignment with project objectives.
	Project Execution and Monitoring: Oversee project execution, ensuring milestones are met and projects stay on track. Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies.
	Resource Management: Coordinate the allocation of resources, including personnel, equipment, and materials, to meet project requirements. Collaborate with procurement teams to ensure timely acquisition of materials.
	Stakeholder Communication: Serve as the primary point of contact for project stakeholders, including clients, vendors, and internal teams. Provide regular project updates and address any issues or concerns.
	Quality Assurance: Ensure that projects are completed to the highest quality standards and comply with relevant industry regulations and company policies.
	Budget Management: Monitor project budgets and ensure costs are within approved limits. Prepare cost estimates and financial reports as needed.
	Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop contingency plans to mitigate them. Ensure project risks are communicated to stakeholders and addressed appropriately.
	Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate project documentation, including project plans, progress reports, and change requests. Prepare and present project status reports to senior management.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Project Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in project management, with a focus on engineering and/or procurement projects.
	Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or equivalent is preferred.
	Strong knowledge of project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall).
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in project management software tools, such as Microsoft Project or Primavera.
	Ability to lead cross-functional teams and work effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
	Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
